block.p: Valerie Ann Feinberg, a daughter of Carol and David H. Feinberg of New York, is to be married today to Theodore Urwitz Schweitzer, a son of Suzanne Schweitzer and Dr. Stuart O. Schweitzer of Los Angeles. Rabbi Simon Jacobson is to officiate at the bride's parents' house in Greenwich, Conn.

The bride, 31, was until March an architectural designer at Avinash K. Malhotra Architects in New York. She graduated cum laude from Princeton and received a master's degree in architecture from the University of California at Los Angeles. Her father owns Feinberg Realty, a real estate development company in New York. Her mother owns Bookberries, a bookshop, and Eagles Antiques, both in Manhattan.

Valerie Ann Feinberg, a daughter of Carol and David H. Feinberg of New York, is to be married today to Theodore Urwitz Schweitzer, a son of Suzanne Schweitzer and Dr. Stuart O. Schweitzer of Los Angeles. Rabbi Simon Jacobson is to officiate at the bride's parents' house in Greenwich, Conn.

The bride, 31, was until March an architectural designer at Avinash K. Malhotra Architects in New York. She graduated cum laude from Princeton and received a master's degree in architecture from the University of California at Los Angeles. Her father owns Feinberg Realty, a real estate development company in New York. Her mother owns Bookberries, a bookshop, and Eagles Antiques, both in Manhattan.

The bridegroom, 30, is an assistant general counsel at Tishman Speyer Properties, the real estate development company in New York. He graduated from Columbia University, where he also earned a law degree. His parents work at the University of California at Los Angeles, where his father is a professor of economics and his mother is the coordinator of clinical drug trials in the division of nephrology at U.C.L.A. Medical Center.
